item.title: Honorable Discharge (Hilton H. Hauger)
item.dc:creator: Technician, 4th Grade Adam K. Stachurski
item.description:
HONORABLE DISCHARGE

FROM THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA

This is to certify that

Hilton H. Hauger     Cpl.     DP2S3

was Honorably Discharged from the

UNITED STATES ARMY

on the 15TH day of April 2021. This certificate is awarded

as a testimonial of Honest and Faithful Service





ARPC-OPM-O

DATE: 15TH April 2021

MEMORANDUM FOR Commander,

U.S. Army 29th Infantry Division, ATTN: AHRC-OP-S, 1 Reserve Way

Fort Belvoir, VA 22060


SUBJECT: Unqualified Resignation


1.I hereby tender my unqualified resignation as an Enlisted Soldier in the

United States Army under the provisions of Chapter 6, Section III,

AR 135-175.

2.I understand that if my resignation is accepted I am entitled to an

honorable separation and will be furnished an Honorable Discharge

Certificate. I understand that I cannot resign if I am a statutory obligor.


Hilton H. Hauger
Signature
Hilton H. Hauger
Name (Type or Print)
Corporal Rifleman Dog Company, Second Platoon, Third Squad
Rank Position Platoon/Squad

Unable to attend drills.

Reason for leaving
APPROVED
Approved/Disapproved
Commander Signature
15TH April 2021
Date

item.title: Honorable Discharge (Daniel A. Balzer)
item.dc:creator: T4 Burg
item.description:
HONORABLE DISCHARGE

FROM THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA

This is to certify that

Daniel A. Balzer     First Sergeant     Charlie Company

was Honorably Discharged from the

UNITED STATES ARMY

on the 30th day of April 2021. This certificate is awarded

as a testimonial of Honest and Faithful Service





ARPC-OPM-O

DATE: 30 April 2021

MEMORANDUM FOR Commander,

U.S. Army 29th Infantry Division, ATTN: AHRC-OP-S, 1 Reserve Way

Fort Belvoir, VA 22060


SUBJECT: Unqualified Resignation


1.I hereby tender my unqualified resignation as an Enlisted Soldier in the

United States Army under the provisions of Chapter 6, Section III,

AR 135-175.

2.I understand that if my resignation is accepted I am entitled to an

honorable separation and will be furnished an Honorable Discharge

Certificate. I understand that I cannot resign if I am a statutory obligor.


Signature
Daniel A. Balzer
Name (Type or Print)
First Sergeant Senior NCO Charlie Company
Rank Position Platoon/Squad
In my twelve plus years year I have seen the 29th through many ups and downs. I am very happy to see it on an up again. Time has come for me to step away for a while, and I feel I can step away with things going in the right direction. I have met many people that I have learned to count on and respect. Lt. Cols Wilson & Wheatley, MSgt. Conrad, Cpts Hill and Morra, 2Lt.s Mills, Bergstrom, and all others Wozniak Frank, Zim, Sung, Kloby, Brindle, Brotz, Erb, Dott and all the other old by gone guys I am forgetting. Charlie's current leadership is pushing forward and I am confident they have this under control. Ever forward 29th.
Reason for leaving
APPROVED
Approved/Disapproved
Commander Signature
30 April 2021
Date

item.title: Honorable Discharge (Berkay Ergen)
item.dc:creator: T4 Burg
item.description:
HONORABLE DISCHARGE

FROM THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA

This is to certify that

Berkay Ergen     Private, First Class     CP2S2

was Honorably Discharged from the

UNITED STATES ARMY

on the 30th day of April 2021. This certificate is awarded

as a testimonial of Honest and Faithful Service





ARPC-OPM-O

DATE: 30 April 2021

MEMORANDUM FOR Commander,

U.S. Army 29th Infantry Division, ATTN: AHRC-OP-S, 1 Reserve Way

Fort Belvoir, VA 22060


SUBJECT: Unqualified Resignation


1.I hereby tender my unqualified resignation as an Enlisted Soldier in the

United States Army under the provisions of Chapter 6, Section III,

AR 135-175.

2.I understand that if my resignation is accepted I am entitled to an

honorable separation and will be furnished an Honorable Discharge

Certificate. I understand that I cannot resign if I am a statutory obligor.


Berkay Ergen
Signature
Berkay Ergen
Name (Type or Print)
Private, First Class Rifleman Charlie Company, Second Platoon, Second Squad
Rank Position Platoon/Squad
29th is a community which provides a huge experience of realistic and strategic firefight. I enjoyed the every minutes of every operation, drill and FNF's, even when I was spectating. All the members are so kind, helpful and friendly. Sometimes we even had very long conversations like a real friend. I have never felt strange in this community and all its members are valuable to me.
Reason for leaving
APPROVED
Approved/Disapproved
Commander Signature
30 April 2021
Date

item.title: Honorable Discharge (Christian O. Wright)
item.dc:creator: T3 Grimes [Ret.]
item.description:
HONORABLE DISCHARGE

FROM THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA

This is to certify that

Christian O. Wright     Cpl.     FP2S1

was Honorably Discharged from the

UNITED STATES ARMY

on the 18th day of April 2021. This certificate is awarded

as a testimonial of Honest and Faithful Service





ARPC-OPM-O

DATE: 18. April 2021

MEMORANDUM FOR Commander,

U.S. Army 29th Infantry Division, ATTN: AHRC-OP-S, 1 Reserve Way

Fort Belvoir, VA 22060


SUBJECT: Unqualified Resignation


1.I hereby tender my unqualified resignation as an Enlisted Soldier in the

United States Army under the provisions of Chapter 6, Section III,

AR 135-175.

2.I understand that if my resignation is accepted I am entitled to an

honorable separation and will be furnished an Honorable Discharge

Certificate. I understand that I cannot resign if I am a statutory obligor.


Christian O. Wright
Signature
Christian O. Wright
Name (Type or Print)
Corporal Squad Leader Fox Company, Second Platoon, First Squad
Rank Position Platoon/Squad

"If you asked six months ago where I'd be discharging would be a joke of an answer. But life has moved incredibly fast. The 29th has been a family for me these last three years and I will miss every one of you. To my squad, when we started it was rough. But you have now become an effective unit as well as an amazing group of people. I leave you in good hands. I won't say goodbye, since I'll be back, so for now see you soon."
Reason for leaving
APPROVED
Approved/Disapproved
Commander Signature

18. April 2021
Date

item.title: Honorable Discharge (Sreeraj S. Kilgore)
item.dc:creator: Technician, 4th Grade Adam K. Stachurski
item.description:
HONORABLE DISCHARGE

FROM THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA

This is to certify that

Sreeraj S. Kilgore     PFC     DP3S3

was Honorably Discharged from the

UNITED STATES ARMY

on the 7TH day of April 2021. This certificate is awarded

as a testimonial of Honest and Faithful Service





ARPC-OPM-O

DATE: 7TH April 2021

MEMORANDUM FOR Commander,

U.S. Army 29th Infantry Division, ATTN: AHRC-OP-S, 1 Reserve Way

Fort Belvoir, VA 22060


SUBJECT: Unqualified Resignation


1.I hereby tender my unqualified resignation as an Enlisted Soldier in the

United States Army under the provisions of Chapter 6, Section III,

AR 135-175.

2.I understand that if my resignation is accepted I am entitled to an

honorable separation and will be furnished an Honorable Discharge

Certificate. I understand that I cannot resign if I am a statutory obligor.


Sreeraj S. Kilgore
Signature
Sreeraj S. Kilgore
Name (Type or Print)
Private, First Class Rifleman Dog Company, Third Platoon, Third Squad
Rank Position Platoon/Squad

Its been a fun ride for the past 1 year and it has been my longest tour with the unit till date. I joined for my second stint with the unit and met with some amazing people who has helped me to improve in game and as a person. I would like to thank all the members of my former squads DP1S3,DP1S4 and current squad DP3S3 and also to all the others I have met in the company during my time here. I use this opportunity to thank T/5 Elbayed, PFC Meerts, 2Lt. Griffin ,Cpl. J.Lee and Cpl. Voth who has led me during my time with the unit and for all those exciting opportunities you presented to me. Lastly , I thank everyone of the unit for giving me this wonderful opportunity and experience.

Reason for leaving
APPROVED
Approved/Disapproved
Commander Signature
7TH April 2021
Date

Georg Scorzeni
Signature
Georg Scorzeni
Name (Type or Print)
Private, First Class Second Class Machine Gunner Dog Company, First Platoon, Fourth Squad
Rank Position Platoon/Squad

This place has an amazing community. I have not met so many different and bright people from all over the world. The 29th is an amazing mechanism in which combine respect, fan, communication and leadership. It doesn't matter how old you are or how you speak English. And it realy works. In 2020 I have a family and a wonderful son! And a litle chaos in my evening schedule, as a bonus) I became richer in soul for more than 2 years in the 29th. I am grateful to the 29th, grateful to the my commanders Sgt. Knezevich, T/5 Elbayed, PFC Meerts, grateful to the mates in the squad. Indeed, there are many interesting moments. Have a gooood luck. And look after my MG bro;)

Reason for leaving
APPROVED
Approved/Disapproved
Commander Signature
30TH March 2021
Date

Fort Belvoir, VA 22060


SUBJECT: Unqualified Resignation


1.I hereby tender my unqualified resignation as an Enlisted Soldier in the

United States Army under the provisions of Chapter 6, Section III,

AR 135-175.

2.I understand that if my resignation is accepted I am entitled to a

General separation and will be furnished a General Discharge

Certificate. I understand that I cannot resign if I am a statutory obligor.
